threat: If a user were tricked in to  opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit  these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute  arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox.
If a user were tricked in  to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially  exploit this to bypass security restrictions.
If a user were tricked in to  opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially  exploit this to steal confidential information.
If a user were tricked in to opening a specially  crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to conduct  cross-site request forgery (XSRF) attacks.
If a user  connected to a malicious web proxy, an attacker could potentially exploit  this to conduct session-fixation attacks.
If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted  website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial  of service.

If a user were  tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could  potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application  crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking  Firefox.
